title: Export Accounts to Mobile Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I'm using macOS 15.0.1 and Thunderbird 128.4.2esr (64-bit). I want to export my settings to the mobile version of Thunderbird using the QR code. However, when I select "Export for Mobile," I don't see any accounts available for export, and both buttons are grayed out. I have five IMAP accounts set up.

-- jacek
creator: jacek29

title: Finding Address books after upgrade of internal storage to 2 TB in Thunderbird
content:
The situation is the following. I had the Geek Squad from Best Buy upgrade my Hp Envy laptop internal storage from 512 GB to 2 TBs Oct 29-31, 2024. I use Thunderbird and have done so for at least 19 yrs. I was told that I would need to download all the application programs again after the upgrade , but that all my data would be stored on the download they did from my internal storage to the new storage. I successfully reinstalled the Thunderbird Program. However I am missing all my contacts in my address books except for 24 names and addresses. I truthfully don't know how many I had in each address book but as I said I have been using this program for 19yrs. So it was in the hundreds. The Geek Squad member tried to fix this but was unable to locate the correct file that the address contacts might be located, I think he tried a mab file. They said that since it was a third party app that I should try Thunderbird Support. Have I lost all my addresses or is there a way to search for them using my new internal storage?. Since this is an HP laptop with a Microsoft 11, it has OneDrive so I am sure that there is a complication in finding the file once I know the type of file I need to be looking for. Thanks for any advice you can give on this matter.

Madeleine Mitchell,
creator: Rngmaddy

title: Thunderbird Email restore
content: I need an EXPERT in Thunderbird email program to restore emails that are in my profile, but not accessible. I am willing to pay if you are an expert. Please email me at fr33dom1@att.net
